item.title: Organizing Content with Tags and Categories
item.description:
Tags and categories help readers find related content. Hwaro makes it easy to set up taxonomies.

Adding Tags

Simply add a tags array in your front matter:

+++
title = "My Post"
tags = ["crystal", "web"]
+++

Each tag automatically gets its own listing page at /tags/<tag-name>/.

Categories

Categories work the same way:

categories = ["tutorials"]

Browse all categories at /categories/.

Custom Taxonomies

You can define any taxonomy in config.toml:

[[taxonomies]]
name = "authors"

Then use authors = ["Alice"] in your front matter.

{{< alert type="info" message="Taxonomy feeds can be enabled per-taxonomy with feed = true." >}}

item.title: Getting Started with Hwaro
item.description:
Hwaro is a fast and lightweight static site generator written in Crystal. In this post, I'll walk you through the basics.

Installation

You can install Hwaro via Homebrew:

brew tap hahwul/hwaro
brew install hwaro

Creating Your First Site

hwaro init my-site
cd my-site
hwaro serve

That's it! Your site is running at http://localhost:3000.

Project Structure

A Hwaro site has a simple layout:

  • config.toml — site configuration
  • content/ — your Markdown files
  • templates/ — Jinja2 templates
  • static/ — assets copied as-is

{{< alert type="tip" message="Run hwaro serve --open to auto-open the browser." >}}

What's Next?

Try creating a new post in content/posts/ and watch it appear automatically with live reload.
